data.current_summary: Fetch a list of your playlists.
data.current_description:
This endpoint returns same data as listennotes.com/listen under your account.
You can use the **page** parameter to do pagination and fetch more playlists.
data.description_suggestion: Fetch all playlists created by the authenticated user. Returns a paginated list of playlists with their metadata. Use the **page** parameter for pagination. Each playlist can contain episodes or podcasts and may be public, unlisted, or private. This endpoint requires authentication and returns only playlists owned by the authenticated user.

Returns empty or null if demographic data is unavailable for the requested podcast.

message: Operation 'deletePodcastById' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, not_actionable. Original summary 'Request to delete a podcast' is vague and doesn't clarify that this is an asynchronous review process, not immediate deletion. Description is verbose and unclear about the actual action. Improved summary emphasizes the submission and review nature. Reorganized description for clarity: purpose, expected behavior, response status values, notification options, and intended user type. Better AI agent interpretability regarding when to use this endpoint and what to expect.

data.current_description: Podcast hosting services can use this endpoint to streamline the process of podcast deletion on behave of their users (podcasters). We will review the deletion request within 12 hours. If the podcast is already deleted, the "status" field in the response will be "deleted". Otherwise, the status field will be "in review". If you want to get a notification once the podcast is deleted, you can configure a webhook url in the dashboard: listennotes.com/api/dashboard/#webhooks
data.summary_suggestion: Submit podcast deletion request for review
data.description_suggestion: Submit a podcast deletion request on behalf of podcasters. The deletion request enters a review process that completes within 12 hours. Returns a status indicating either "in review" (pending deletion) or "deleted" (already removed). Podcast hosting services can configure webhook notifications in the dashboard to receive updates when deletion is complete. This endpoint is intended for podcast hosting services managing deletions on behalf of their users.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Request to delete a podcast' is vague and doesn't clarify that this is an asynchronous review process, not immediate deletion. Description is verbose and unclear about the actual action. Improved summary emphasizes the submission and review nature. Reorganized description for clarity: purpose, expected behavior, response status values, notification options, and intended user type. Better AI agent interpretability regarding when to use this endpoint and what to expect.

data.current_summary: Fetch a list of podcast genres
data.current_description:
Get a list of podcast genres that are supported in Listen Notes.
The genre id can be passed to other endpoints as a parameter to get podcasts in a specific genre,
e.g., `GET /best_podcasts`, `GET /search`...
You may want to cache the list of genres on the client side.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieve all podcast genres supported by Listen Notes. Returns a list of genre objects with genre ids and names. Genre ids can be used as filter parameters in other endpoints such as GET /best_podcasts and GET /search to retrieve podcasts within specific genres. This list is relatively static and should be cached on the client side to minimize API calls.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and appropriate. Description explains the purpose and downstream usage well, but lacks specificity about the response structure (what fields are returned). Enhanced description clarifies the return value format, reinforces the caching recommendation with rationale, and provides better context for AI agents to understand the operation's role in the broader API ecosystem.

message: Operation 'search' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Full-text search' is too generic and doesn't specify what is being searched. Description lacks clarity about what data is returned. Enhanced summary to specify search targets and improved description to include return value information and clearer plan-based pagination limits for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
Full-text search on episodes, podcasts, or curated lists of podcasts.
Use the `offset` parameter to paginate through search results.
The FREE plan allows to see up to 30 search results (or `offset` < 30) per query.
The PRO plan allows to see up to 300 search results (or `offset` < 300) per query.
The ENTERPRISE plan allows to see up to 10,000 search results (or `offset` < 10000) per query.
data.summary_suggestion: Search podcasts, episodes, and curated lists
data.description_suggestion: Perform full-text search across episodes, podcasts, and curated podcast lists. Supports pagination via the `offset` parameter with plan-dependent limits: FREE plan (up to 30 results), PRO plan (up to 300 results), ENTERPRISE plan (up to 10,000 results). Returns matching podcasts and episodes with metadata including podcast IDs, titles, descriptions, and listen scores.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Full-text search' is too generic and doesn't specify what is being searched. Description lacks clarity about what data is returned. Enhanced summary to specify search targets and improved description to include return value information and clearer plan-based pagination limits for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_summary: Fetch a list of best podcasts by genre
data.current_description:
Get a list of curated best podcasts by genre,
which are curated by Listen Notes staffs based on various signals from the Internet, e.g.,
top charts on other podcast platforms, recommendations from mainstream media,
user activities on listennotes.com...
You can get the genre ids from `GET /genres` endpoint.
This endpoint returns same data as https://www.listennotes.com/best-podcasts/
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve curated best podcasts by genre
data.description_suggestion: Retrieve curated lists of best podcasts organized by genre. Results are curated by Listen Notes staff based on multiple signals including top charts from other platforms, mainstream media recommendations, and user activity on listennotes.com. Requires a genre ID (obtainable from the GET /genres endpoint). Returns podcast metadata including titles, descriptions, listen scores, and artwork. Data mirrors the best-podcasts section on listennotes.com.

data.current_description:
Full-text search on episodes, podcasts, or curated lists of podcasts.

The PRO plan allows to see up to 300 search results (or `offset` < 300) per query.
The ENTERPRISE plan allows to see up to 10,000 search results (or `offset` < 10000) per query.
data.summary_suggestion: Search podcasts, episodes, and curated lists
data.description_suggestion: Perform full-text search across episodes, podcasts, and curated podcast lists. Supports pagination via the `offset` parameter with plan-dependent limits: FREE plan (up to 30 results), PRO plan (up to 300 results), ENTERPRISE plan (up to 10,000 results). Returns matching podcasts and episodes with metadata including podcast IDs, titles, descriptions, and listen scores.

data.current_description: Podcast hosting services can use this endpoint to streamline the process of podcast deletion on behave of their users (podcasters). We will review the deletion request within 12 hours. If the podcast is already deleted, the "status" field in the response will be "deleted". Otherwise, the status field will be "in review". If you want to get a notification once the podcast is deleted, you can configure a webhook url in the dashboard: listennotes.com/api/dashboard/#webhooks
data.summary_suggestion: Submit podcast deletion request for review
data.description_suggestion: Submit a podcast deletion request on behalf of podcasters. The deletion request enters a review process that completes within 12 hours. Returns a status indicating either "in review" (pending deletion) or "deleted" (already removed). Podcast hosting services can configure webhook notifications in the dashboard to receive updates when deletion is complete. This endpoint is intended for podcast hosting services managing deletions on behalf of their users.

data.current_description:
Full-text search on episodes, podcasts, or curated lists of podcasts.
Use the `offset` parameter to paginate through search results.
The FREE plan allows to see up to 30 search results (or `offset` < 30) per query.
The PRO plan allows to see up to 300 search results (or `offset` < 300) per query.
The ENTERPRISE plan allows to see up to 10,000 search results (or `offset` < 10000) per query.
data.summary_suggestion: Search podcasts, episodes, and curated lists
data.description_suggestion: Perform full-text search across episodes, podcasts, and curated podcast lists. Supports pagination via the `offset` parameter with plan-dependent limits: FREE plan (up to 30 results), PRO plan (up to 300 results), ENTERPRISE plan (up to 10,000 results). Returns matching podcasts and episodes with metadata including podcast IDs, titles, descriptions, and listen scores.

data.current_description: Podcast hosting services can use this endpoint to streamline the process of podcast deletion on behave of their users (podcasters). We will review the deletion request within 12 hours. If the podcast is already deleted, the "status" field in the response will be "deleted". Otherwise, the status field will be "in review". If you want to get a notification once the podcast is deleted, you can configure a webhook url in the dashboard: listennotes.com/api/dashboard/#webhooks
data.summary_suggestion: Submit podcast deletion request for review
data.description_suggestion: Submit a podcast deletion request on behalf of podcasters. The deletion request enters a review process that completes within 12 hours. Returns a status indicating either "in review" (pending deletion) or "deleted" (already removed). Podcast hosting services can configure webhook notifications in the dashboard to receive updates when deletion is complete. This endpoint is intended for podcast hosting services managing deletions on behalf of their users.
